channel.title: C# and XNA - Voxel Engine - My Game I've Been Working on for Over a Month
channel.description:
Hey guys. After a lot of thinking about whether or not to post this here, I decided I would. This is a game I've been working on since late February, and although it just looks like a "Minecraft clone", I have so many unique ideas and in the end there will be no games like it. I would love to describe everything I have planned, but someone might run away with the ideas - they're that good! :P
So I've been posting update videos consistently every time I create a new feature. This ranges from random world generation to creating animations in my model editor. You can find them all on my channel, but here I'll just post some of the cool ones (Note that some stuff changed from what was in the older videos): www.youtube.com/user/Linscape99
First though, here is what the game [b]started as[/b]: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_09q_bhERkw
Now the cool stuff!
[b]Creating and animating a model in my own model editor[/b] http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0BNi3xkzdS4
[b]Characters in-game wielding weapons[/b] http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dRrmOsx5QZc
[b]World Generation[/b] http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uLLfTNRz91Q
[b]Scenery Generation[/b] http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rCLrRTN0U6Y
And of course, the latest video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LYSDkAnQT1M
If you don't want to watch those, here's a couple of screenshots: [img]http://puu.sh/2u1Ow[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/2tpjH[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/2sV2I[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/2i0ZP[/img]
~Lin

item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“Travas, post:9, topic:514519”]Any updates?[/quote]Quite a few actually. I haven’t kept this topic completely up-to-date because I haven’t posted new videos, but I’ve gone through some design changes. The main one includes a scrapping of the current Minecraft-like lighting in favor of a “common” kind of lighting where lights emit an attenuating sphere of light that travels through blocks. It might sound weird, but I came up with a cool idea that makes it work. I’m also trying to name the game, but what I’m coming up with has been taken. What I’ve tried is Lights Out and Red Line.

Another change is favoring flatter terrain as opposed to mountains and a steep climb from the beach. Especially with the new lighting, they can be really hard to navigate and when it comes time to placing structures, it’s going to be a lot harder to control their placement and assure proper access. Plus combat is a lot harder on steep slopes, so like I said, I’m shifting towards flatter landscapes.

Oh, and I’ve also started working on music ideas. I’ve got a few cool ones so far that really sound like Megaman X songs, so I’m really looking forward to actually creating them.

item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“Travas, post:5, topic:514519”]@Lin, what is the reason behind temperature?[/quote]When a world generates, a bunch of factors go into it. The closer the temperature is to .7, the more plants there will be, the higher the temperature, the greener the grass and the lower the temperature, the bluer it will be. Dirt and stone also change color. There will be several other aspects, and when you create a world (one of the ideas in the game is to create and travel from world to world), you’ll be able to edit those factors based on the blocks/items you ‘contribute’.

Edit: Worlds now wrap like an island, and water looks better.
